Installation

This guide covers the installation process for sphinx-typesense, a Sphinx extension for integrating Typesense search.

Prerequisites

Before installing sphinx-typesense, ensure you have the following:

  • Python 3.9 or higher installed on your system
  • pip or uv package manager available
  • Access to a Typesense server (local or Typesense Cloud)

Python Version Requirements

sphinx-typesense requires Python 3.9 or later. You can check your Python version by running:

python --version

Installation Methods

There are several ways to install sphinx-typesense depending on your preferred workflow.

Using pip

The simplest way to install is using pip:

pip install sphinx-typesense

This will install the package and all required dependencies.

Using uv

For faster installation with uv:

uv add sphinx-typesense

Installing from Source

To install the latest development version from source:

  1. Clone the repository from GitHub
  2. Navigate to the project directory
  3. Install with pip in editable mode
git clone https://github.com/JacobCoffee/sphinx-typesense.git
cd sphinx-typesense
pip install -e .

Basic Configuration

After installation, add the extension to your Sphinx conf.py:

extensions = ["sphinx_typesense"]

Required Settings

Configure the connection to your Typesense server:

typesense_host = "localhost"
typesense_port = "8108"
typesense_protocol = "http"
typesense_api_key = "your_admin_key"
typesense_search_api_key = "your_search_key"

API Key Configuration

You should use separate API keys for indexing and searching. The admin key is used during build time for indexing, while the search key is exposed in the frontend for queries.

Next Steps

After installation and configuration:

  • Run sphinx-build to index your documentation
  • Verify the search UI appears in your built documentation
  • Test search functionality with various queries

For advanced configuration options, see the Configuration Guide.
